scene_description_enriched: The scene depicts four figures, two in elaborate ecclesiastical attire and two in royal regalia. The two figures on the left wear miters and ornate robes, suggesting they are high-ranking clergy, possibly bishops or even the Pope. The figure on the far left wears a papal tiara. The two figures on the right wear crowns, indicating they are kings. The figure second from the right has a long beard. The figures are positioned in a close grouping, with hands gesturing or clasped in prayer. The background suggests an architectural setting with arches and decorative elements, possibly a church or palace interior.
scene_interpretation: This scene likely represents a council or meeting of religious and secular authorities, possibly depicting a historical event involving the Pope and kings, or a symbolic representation of the Church and State in dialogue or agreement.
